ygData.subject: Re: Twinking Causes a Crisis of Faith
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Amen to that. I love the monster slaying part of EQ, mainly the teamwork part, as a good group of well played characters is the most fun I ve had in the
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, Dec 01/99, silky@... wrote:
>
> My focus is LIVING in the world - not monster slaying. UO is much better
> for that - play that too, the ONLY reason I am in EQ at all - my husband
> started playing, and it is nice not to get stabbed in the back by a teammate.

Amen to that. I love the monster slaying part of EQ, mainly the teamwork
part, as a good group of well played characters is the most fun I've had
in the game, but I miss the socializing part of UO a lot too. I probably
spent as much time hanging around the bank in Britain chatting with
friends and meeting new ones as I did in the dungeons. Come to think of
it, I probably spent more time in town than out in UO.

I don't, however, miss the backstabbing by random strangers part of UO.
I hope someday someone creates a game that has the best of both these 2
games in it. I think they'd have a real winning game.

--
Artificial Intelligence stands no chance against Natural Stupidity.
